Class ProgMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • ProgMenu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StaffScreen, UserScreen

    public class ProgMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the father class of StaffScreen and UserScreen
    classes. Involves the mainMenu method and the methods that
    will be used by 2 child classes.
    Author:
    151044005 Hakki Erdem Duman

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProgMenu

        public ProgMenu()

    • Method Detail

      • mainMenu

        public void mainMenu()
        This method is the main menu method. This is called by
        main method of the java file to create an interface for user
        to use program easily. User can do the operations by entering
        numbers.

      • about

        public void about()
        This method runs the "about" menu.

      • help

        public void help(java.util.Scanner fooInput,
                 int flag)
        This method runs the help menu. Also in this method,
        there is an example of polymorphism. Help method of the
        user or staff is called according to user's choice.
        Parameters:
        fooInput - to read input from user.
        flag - to avoid not to write the header of the menu again.

      • backup

        public static void backup(java.lang.String fileName,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> myList)
        This method stores the datas of the file that we send
        as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name that we want to backup.
        myList - the list that we want to store the datas.

      • isFileValid

        public boolean isFileValid(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method checks whether there is a file like we send as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name that we want to check.
        Returns:
        returns true if there is a file that is named like this.
        Returns false if not.

      • isFileEmpty

        public boolean isFileEmpty(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method checks whether the file that we send
        as a parameter is empty or not.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name that we want to check.
        Returns:
        returns true if the file is empty.
        Returns false if not.

      • bookList

        public void bookList(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method prints the book list on the screen.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name that involves the book list.
